lead_paragraph: When his signs supporting Donald J. Trump for president were stolen or vandalized at his home in Queens, Michael Ricatto tried to catch the perpetrator. What happened next was a surprise.

headline.print_headline: Quest to Find a Trump-Sign Thief Leads to Fines and Suspicions of Bias
headline.main: Trump Signs, Trees and Accusations That a New York Agency Is Biased

snippet: When his signs supporting Donald J. Trump for president were stolen or vandalized at his home in Queens, Michael Ricatto tried to catch the perpetrator. What happened next was a surprise....
abstract: Kew Gardens, Queens, resident Michael Ricatto is fined by Parks Dept for posting fliers offering reward for information about thief who stole pro-Trump signs from his yard; signs had been stapled to trees, which could damage and potentially kill them; Ricatto says fines are motivated by political favoritism.
